page.title: 03Mr.Crick from Cockernhoe
page.content: Mr.Crick moved into Cockernhoe when he was five years old.He liked school. His first pals were Victor Simpkins,Cyril Clark, Brian Winch, Clifford Webb,Dan Chapman,Leonard Clark.He went to Offley when he was 11,and his best friend there was Percy Clark.They played football and cricket.He had a crystal set when he was young,and then a T.V.set in 1952.The only houses then were in Luton Road, Mangrove Road and St.Hugh's.Alf Baringer's car was the first one he saw. Mr.Crick's hobby was snooker.When a teenager,he would walk to Luton.He would have one present for Christmas.He was married in 1950,and went to Harpenden for a honeymoon.He has lived here now for 53 years.He's got 65 pigeons,which he keeps in his garden and enters them in races.
